cards.name: Ho-Oh
cards.text: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

attacks.name: Scorching Wind
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Black Flame
attacks.text: If Zekrom is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Kyogre
cards.text: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Aqua Storm
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck, and then choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Palkia

abilities.name: Absolute Space
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand.

cards.text: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

attacks.name: Overdrive Smash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Overdrive Smash attack does 80 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Flying Pikachu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Flying Pikachu VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Balloon
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

cards.name: Surfing Pikachu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.name: Surfing Pikachu VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Surfer
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

attacks.name: Field Crush
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium in play, discard it.

attacks.name: White Thunder
attacks.text: If Reshiram is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Mew

abilities.name: Mysterious Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal an Item card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.

cards.name: Xerneas
cards.text: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

attacks.name: Breath of Life
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards of different types and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Cosmog
cards.text: Whether or not it's a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it's in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.

attacks.name: Star Protection
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Cosmoem
cards.text: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.

attacks.name: Star Protection
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Lunala
cards.text: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.

attacks.name: Lunar Pain
attacks.text: Double the number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Shot
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zacian V

abilities.name: Roar of the Sword
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Storm Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Groudon
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.

attacks.name: Magma Volcano
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 80 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Zamazenta V

abilities.name: Growl of the Shield
abilities.text: All of your Fighting Pokémon take 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Growl of the Shield Ability at a time.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.name: Yveltal
cards.text: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

attacks.name: Cry of Destruction
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 Special Energy from your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Temporal Backflow
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Solgaleo

abilities.name: Rush In
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: In writings from the distant past, it's called by the name "the beast that devours the sun."

attacks.name: Solar Geyser
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Lugia
cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Aero Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Crush
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Professor's Research (Professor Oak)
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Professor's Research (Professor Oak)
cards.text: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Mew

abilities.name: Mysterious Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal an Item card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
